text: Here's a quick and easy way

to test your internet
speed using your computer.

First, go to Google and
search "internet speed test."
Above the search results,

you'll see a box labeled
"Internet speed test."
Click the blue "RUN SPEED TEST" button.

A pop-up window will appear
featuring a speedometer,

similar to what you'd see
in your car's dashboard.

The test first measures
your download speed,
then upload speed.
It takes about 30 seconds to complete.
When the test is finished,
it will display your results
in megabits per second, or Mbps.
The higher your Mbps count, the better.
It will also tell you in plain language
if your connection is fast or slow
in a brief summary below the results.

For this test, download speed
is 309.9 megabits per second,

and upload speed is
10.5 megabits per second
and is labeled "very fast."

Any download speed above
25 megabits per second

and any upload speed above
3 megabits per second
is recommended by the FCC.
